title: 395th Army Band Mobile App
description: This was a dream project. I am in the 395th Army Band and serve as a senior leader and platoon sergeant. Communication is key in the unit because we only meet once a month and two weekends over the summer. I created this app to serve as a quick reference for important documents, announcements, and contact info. I also implemented a task manager for admins that allows for adding/editing/deleting tasks and assigning them to specific Soldiers, which then populates in their `My Tasks` screen. This was my first time working with React Native/Expo and it was a lot of fun and I learned a lot about the simple, yet powerful framework that is React Native.
technologies: JavaScript | React | React Native | Supabase | SQL | iOS | Android

title: Green Thumb
technologies: JavaScript | React | Node.js | PostgreSQL | Bootstrap | MBD | AWS
description: My wife and I are avid gardeners. I was looking to make an app that serves as a garden manager and this is what I came up with! I made my own API, hosted on AWS (frontend is S3, API Gateway then calls a Lambda function). Users can add/edit/delete crops from the API that only they create, except for admins - who can add/edit/delete anything. Each crop displays germination/harvest time as well as a brief description. I had a lot of fun with this project and learned a lot about React and just how powerful and responsive it can be.

title: Movie or Snoozie
description: Movie or Snoozie is a fun web app I made that serves as a movie search. A user can save data to localStorage regarding their standards of movie ratings as well as their bedtime. When a user selects a movie, it decides if it is worth watching based on those parameters the user saved.

title: Weather, Will I?
technologies: HTML | CSS | JavaScript | React | Reactstrap | Bootstrap | MUI | AWS
description: This is a website in progress, but it is currently a weather web app that lets a user search for any city (using a dynamic search bar), shows current and future weather, and has some 'Will I...' questions that populate based on the searched weather results. Hosted on AWS in an S3 bucket.

title: Portfolio Website
description: The portfolio website you're on now! Built using React. Hosted on AWS in an S3 bucket.

title: Hack or Snooze (HackerNews Clone)
description: This is a clone of the Hackernews forum/website. It was my first time learning backend frameworks and really liked the simplicity and power of Node.js and NextJS. Frontend hosted through Github Pages.

title: Jeopardy
description: A JavaScript based web app that uses game logic, utilizes an API, and some good ole-fashioned DOM manipulation. Had a lot of fun with this one, but I did learn about the imperfections of APIs and how to manipulate API responses with a little conditioning. Hosted through Github Pages.

title: Connect Four
description: This was a fun game-logic project when learning the in's and out's of JavaScript. I learned about DOM manipulation, game logic, and working with APIs. Hosted through Github Pages.
